messages.title: A fairer Lambeth
messages.content: First class education for children. A housing policy we can all afford and protects the local environment. A real say for local people on local issues.

messages.title: A safer Lambeth
messages.content: More police on the beat. Crack down on late night shops which are hubs for trouble. An end to knife crime on our streets.

messages.title: Caroline works hard for our area
messages.content: Campaigning for a one-hour bus ticket. Clamping down on council waste such as Lambeth Life. An Oyster card for your bike.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A housing policy we can all afford and that protects the local environment.
A real say for local people on local issues.
More police on the beat and an end to knife crime on our streets.
Crack down on late night shops which are hubs for trouble.
Campaigning for a one-hour bus ticket and an Oyster card for your bike.
Clamping down on council waste such as Lambeth Life.

mentions.candidate: Caroline Pidgeon, As the Liberal Democrat London Assembly Leader, has been active on issues such as...
mentions.tacticalSituation: Her work has been recognised by The Guardian, the BBC Radio 4 Today Programme, and CBS News, which speak highly of her.

issues.economy: Clamping down on council waste such as Lambeth Life.
issues.environment: A housing policy that protects the local environment.
issues.governance: A real say for local people on local issues.

housing.content: A housing policy we can all afford and that protects the local environment.

endorsements.endorser: The Guardian, the BBC Radio 4 Today Programme, and CBS News

images.caption: Images of Caroline Pidgeon engaging with the community, such as talking to police officers, interacting with the public, and campaigning for public transport improvements.
